headline: Why Hasbro (HAS) Is Up 9.2% After Q4 Beat, New Licensing Deals And Capital Return Moves – And What's Next
summary: In February 2026, Hasbro reported fourth-quarter 2025 results showing US$1,445.9 million in sales and US$201.6 million in net income, alongside new product reveals, licensing partnerships, a US$1.00 billion share repurchase plan, and a US$0.70 quarterly dividend. Hasbro’s return to Toy Fair, expansion of brands like PEPPA PIG and MONOPOLY, and long-term deals with franchises such as Harry Potter, Voltron, and Amazon MGM’s content highlight how the company is leaning on partnerships, IP and...
